Breaking: TFAW & Hollywood Cancel Walking Dead Screenings

Posted on November 20, 2012November 28, 2012 by ruckuslauren

Due to forces outside of their control, Things From Another World (TFAW) and the Hollywood Theatre regretfully announce that they are canceling their free weekly screenings of The Walking Dead Season 3, effective immediately.

TFAW has sponsored free screenings of The Walking Dead with hosts cortandfatboy for two and a half seasons, and is greatly saddened to cancel this popular Portland event, after the Hollywood Theatre received a cease-and-desist letter.

“We’ve had a great run with The Walking Dead, and we are still huge fans of both the comics and the television show,” said TFAW Senior Director of Retail Operations Andrew McIntire. “It’s allowed us to reach out to the community in a unique way, and we’re grateful for all of the awesome people we’ve met through this. We’re sorry to disappoint anyone, but we have no choice in the matter.”

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Comics, Events Tagged Hollywood Theatre, TFAW, The Walking Dead, Things From Another World 1 Comment

TFAW HOSTS SIGNING FOR EISNER-WINNING ARTIST FRANCESCO FRANCAVILLA

Posted on November 19, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From TFAW:

Things From Another World (TFAW) is proud to announce yet another premier event this November: a signing with Eisner Award-winning artist Francesco Francavilla (Batman: The Black Mirror, Captain America & Bucky) Saturday, November 24 from 6 to 9 p.m. at their Portland store! Take a break from family time Thanksgiving weekend and spend time with your comics family. Free food and beer (for those 21+) provided!

Francesco Francavilla, who won the 2012 Eisner Award for Best Cover Artist, is well known for his amazing retro pieces for Lone Ranger, Dark Shadows, Archie Meets Kiss, and Black Panther. He’s currently doing full interiors for Marvel’s Captain America & Black Widow, with writer Cullen Bunn.

Make sure to take advantage of their epic Black Friday Sale, starting November 23, with fantastic discounts, $2 doorbusters, and more!

Francesco Francavilla Signing
Saturday, November 24
6 to 9 p.m
Portland TFAW,
2916 NE Broadway
RSVP on Facebook

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Comics Tagged Black Friday, Black Widow, Bucky, Captain America, Eisner Award, Francesco Francavilla, TFAW, Things From Another World Leave a comment

SINA GRACE SIGNING & GALLERY: NOT MY BAG AND LI’L DEPRESSED BOY 11/14

Posted on November 12, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From TFAW:

Writer-artist Sina Grace has created beloved cult-hit comics Li’l Depressed Boy and Not My Bag for Image Comics and worked as editorial director for Robert Kirkman’s Skybound imprint–and he’s visiting Portland! Meet him November 14 at the Portland TFAW for a signing and gallery show from 7 to 10 p.m. Free food and beer (21+ with valid ID) provided.

Not My Bag is Grace’s semi-autobiographical tale of working in retail hell. A young artist takes a job at a department store in order to make ends meet, but little does he know that he may meet his end! In this gothic story for fans of Persepolis, Blankets, and The Devil Wears Prada, can the artist withstand competitive pressure, treachery, and high fashion while still keeping his soul?

Working on a comic, or thinking about getting started? Grace recently co-headlined the DIY to Image panel at Tucson Comic Con with Li’l Depressed Boy writer S. Steven Struble, offering tips on how creators can get their books noticed. Make sure to bring your questions to TFAW’s Indy Comics Q & A at 7:30 to get practical advice and suggestions from a creator who has immersed himself in nearly every aspect of the comics industry.

Portland TFAW
2916 NE Broadway Portland, OR 97232
Wednesday, November 14
7 to 10 p.m.
RSVP on Facebook

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Comics Tagged Image Comics, Li'l Depressed Boy, Not My Bag, Sina Grace, TFAW, Things From Another World Leave a comment

Volunteer at The Swashbuckler’s Ball

Posted on October 29, 2012 by sarahgiffrow

This just in: our friends at PDX YAR need your help to make this year’s fundraiser event, The Swashbuckler’s Ball, bigger and better than ever, and they’re seeking volunteers to assist in a variety of capacities! Worried you won’t get to enjoy the event? Never fear: there are plenty of shift options that’ll leave you ample time to enjoy the celebration, and you’ll also get some sweet perks–like free admission!–for your time.

From their recent announcement:

Ahoy, the Swashbuckler’s Ball is looking for a few good scallywags to join the crew and become volunteers. You need not be rated able seaman to apply, we will gladly accept lubbers as long as you are willing to work for your passage.

Volunteers are needed to fill several positions through out the night to include load-in, load-out, security, manning check in and raffle tables, raffle ticket sales and LOTS more. As a volunteer, you will work a roughly 3 hour shift, of which there are three. Generally the shifts will run 5:30-8:30pm, 7:30-10:30pm and 8:30-11:30pm and time assignments are on a first come first serve basis.

So, you are probably wondering what you will get out of this engagement. Well, first of all there is GLORY! But, considering you are probably of a piratical sort, there are some more tangible rewards. These include free admission, a drink ticket and, of course, food.

Be that tickling your interest? If so, hoist your signals and email Jen, our wondrous Volunteer Coordinator, at volunteer@swashbucklersball.com.

CONTRIBUTOR: Sarah Giffrow is the owner of Sarah Giffrow Creative, offering design, photography, and web site geekery for Portland small businesses. She also plays roller derby, knows kung fu, and has quite possibly been to more Star Trek conventions than you. 
Posted in Benefits, Events, Music, Performances Leave a comment

Floating World Comics presents: The Projects featuring Plink Flojd

Posted on October 18, 2012October 18, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From the Hollywood Theatre:

The historic Hollywood Theatre is proud to partner with Floating World Comics for Plink Flojd, presented by The Projects and Audio Dregs. This audio visual showcase will also feature live performances from Nice Nice and Regular Music.

Plink Flojd is a super audio/visual collective started by David Quiles Guillo with co-founders Yoshi Sodeoka and Eric Mast AKA E*Rock. Originally inspired by Pink Floyd, the homage is pushed to the next level into a new art form. Members of the collective include: Akin, Andrew Benson, Peter Burr, Cristopher Cichocki, Jason Forrest, Rollin Leonard, Sara Ludy, Shane McAdams, Jonathan McCabe, Austin Meredith, A. Bill Miller, Lorna Mills, Brenna Murphy, Daron Murphy, Sabrina Ratte, and Jimmy Joe Roche.

The Projects brings together experimental artists from comics, animation, and other narrative arts. The show will also feature Cartune Xprez videos curated by Peter Burr and Devin Flynn.

The Projects with Plink Flojd
October 20th doors open at 9:30 pm
The Hollywood Theatre
4122 NE Sandy Blvd.
$5

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Comics, Film, Music Tagged Audio Dregs, Cartune Xprez, Floating World Comics, Nice Nice, Pink Flojd, Regular Music, The Projects Leave a comment

Comics Underground at Jack London Bar

Posted on October 4, 2012November 28, 2012 by ruckuslauren


From Comics Underground:

The sixth installment of Comics Underground—Portland’s quarterly live comic book performance series—is two weeks away. We provide a projector and a microphone; creators bring the music, sound effects, outlandish accents, and anything else they need to translate their work into a full-fledged performance. Also, there is booze.

Here’s a bit more info on this installment’s participants:
Two all-around hilarious dudes, JEFF PARKER and BEN DEWEY are studiomates at local comics hub Periscope Studio, where they collaborated on a Planet of the Apes story. Yes. That means this Comics Underground will feature talking monkeys. With guns!

Nationally syndicated political cartoonist MATT BORS was short-listed for a Pulitzer earlier this year.

LEIA WEATHINGTON and ERIKA MOEN are two local creators who teamed up on the very adults-only story “Easy,” for the lady-friendly anthology Smut Peddler.

Up-and-coming cartoonist LUCY BELLWOOD recently raised more than $10,000 on Kickstarter to fund her autobiographical comic True Believer.

The Jack London Bar is somewhat difficult to find. You have to go into Rialto, walk to the back, and go down the stairs.

Jack London Bar
529 SW 4th (underneath the Rialto—21+)
Thursday, October 18
8 pm (doors at 7:30 ish)
$3

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Comics, Events, Performances Tagged Ben Dewey, Comics Underground, Erika Moen, Jack London Bar, Jeff Parker, Leia Weathington, Lucy Bellwood, Matt Bors Leave a comment

Tonight! Oni Press and Jamie S. Rich present THE BIG SLEEP

Posted on September 27, 2012October 1, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From the Hollywood Theatre:

The Hollywood Theatre teams up with Oni Press to present Howard Hawks’ noir thriller The Big Sleep. Oni contributor Jamie S. Rich will be on hand to discuss how the film inspired and influenced his graphic novel “You Have Killed Me”.

The Big Sleep is a 1946 film noir classic that reunited director Howard Hawks with stars Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall who had starred for him in the 1944 film To Have and Have Not. Bogart plays private detective Philip Marlowe who is hired by the wealthy Sternwood family to investigate a blackmailer. While working the case he falls for the eldest daughter Vivian Rutledge (Bacall) which further complicates the case as it gets gets more mysterious and dangerous. In 1997 The Big Sleep was added to the National Film Registry for it’s cultural and historical significance.

Jamie S. Rich is the author of four novels and the writer of several short stories and comic books including “Love the Way You Love” and “12 Reasons Why I Love Her”. He is a former editor at Oni Press who published the graphic novel “You Have Killed Me”, a collaboration with writer and artist Joelle Jones. Mr. Rich will be on hand to discuss how the film influenced the graphic novel with moderator Tom Shimmin of Oni Press.

Thursday, September 27 at 7:00 PM
The Hollywood Theatre
4122 NE Sandy Blvd
$7

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
Posted in Comics, Film Tagged Hollywood Theatre, Jamie S. Rich, Oni Press, The Big Sleep, You Have Killed Me Leave a comment

Top Shelf’s $3 Sale Ends Friday

Posted on September 25, 2012 by ruckuslauren

From Top Shelf:

Top Shelf is having its annual $3 web sale. When you visit the site, you’ll find 170 graphic novels and comics on sale — with over 100 titles marked down to just $3 & $1. Shipping & handling is a flat fee. Top Shelf uses these funds to help clear the decks on our current releases, and “kick start” a full rollout for next year. To browse the sale items and place your order at the Top Shelf website, click here.

CONTRIBUTOR: Lauren Hudgins is the editor of Describe the Ruckus, a blog on Portland events and culture, a blogger for Ooligan Press, and a PSU creative writing MFA student.
